title: Hippo DEX Aggregation
description: Learn about Hippo DEX, a DEX aggregator on Aptos that sources liquidity from multiple exchanges to provide traders with the best possible rates and minimal slippage for their swaps.

tasks.title: Prepare for Optimal Swaps
tasks.description: Add at least 0.1 APT to your wallet to begin exploring Hippo DEX

tasks.title: DEX Aggregator Basics
tasks.description: Understanding what a DEX aggregator is
tasks.question: What is the main function of a DEX aggregator like Hippo?
options: To create its own liquidity pools
To route trades through multiple DEXes to find the best price
To stake tokens for yield
To lend tokens to users
tasks.correctAnswer: To route trades through multiple DEXes to find the best price

tasks.title: Hippo DEX Partners
tasks.description: Learn about the DEXes Hippo aggregates
tasks.question: Which of these DEXes might Hippo aggregate liquidity from?
options: Only Liquidswap
Only PancakeSwap
Multiple DEXes including Liquidswap, PancakeSwap, and Econia
None - Hippo is a standalone DEX
tasks.correctAnswer: Multiple DEXes including Liquidswap, PancakeSwap, and Econia

tasks.title: Price Improvement
tasks.description: Understanding how Hippo improves swap prices
tasks.question: How does Hippo DEX help users get better prices on their trades?
options: By charging higher fees than other DEXes
By splitting orders across multiple liquidity sources to reduce slippage
By delaying trade execution until prices improve
By only allowing trades above a certain size
tasks.correctAnswer: By splitting orders across multiple liquidity sources to reduce slippage

tasks.title: Smart Order Routing
tasks.question: What is 'smart order routing' in the context of Hippo DEX?
options: A manual process where traders select which DEX to use
An algorithm that calculates the most efficient path for trades across multiple DEXes
A feature that schedules trades for later execution
A special order type that only executes if the price reaches a certain level
tasks.correctAnswer: An algorithm that calculates the most efficient path for trades across multiple DEXes

tasks.title: Token Support
tasks.description: Understanding which tokens you can trade on Hippo
tasks.question: What types of tokens can be traded on Hippo DEX?
options: Only APT and stablecoins
Only tokens created by the Hippo team
Any token pairs that exist on the DEXes Hippo aggregates
Only tokens that have passed a rigorous verification process
tasks.correctAnswer: Any token pairs that exist on the DEXes Hippo aggregates

tasks.title: Fee Structure
tasks.description: Learn about how fees work on Hippo
tasks.question: How does Hippo DEX handle fees?
options: No fees are charged
Hippo charges fees in addition to the underlying DEX fees
Only a portion of trades incur fees
Fees are only charged for tokens created by Hippo
tasks.correctAnswer: Hippo charges fees in addition to the underlying DEX fees

tasks.title: Slippage Protection
tasks.question: How does Hippo DEX help users manage slippage?
options: By requiring high slippage settings
By allowing users to set maximum slippage tolerance and finding optimal routes within that tolerance
By only allowing trades during low volatility periods
Slippage cannot be managed on DEX aggregators
tasks.correctAnswer: By allowing users to set maximum slippage tolerance and finding optimal routes within that tolerance

tasks.title: Technical Implementation
tasks.description: Learn how Hippo is built on Aptos
tasks.question: How is Hippo DEX implemented on Aptos?
options: As an off-chain service with on-chain settlement
Using Solidity smart contracts
As a fully centralized service
Using Move modules deployed on the Aptos blockchain
tasks.correctAnswer: Using Move modules deployed on the Aptos blockchain
